ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 180
ygData.msgSnippet: Here is my 10th lvl cleric head: leather skullcap neck: banded gorget (4pp) ears: nothing face: cloth veil shoulders: rusty spiked shoulder pads (5pp) arms:
ygData.messageBody:
Here is my 10th lvl cleric

head: leather skullcap
neck: banded gorget (4pp)
ears: nothing
face: cloth veil
shoulders: rusty spiked shoulder pads (5pp)
arms: leather
chest: banded (8pp-what a steal !)
back: leather
fingers: silver jasper (?)-I have a buddy that's an enchanter, they cost 3pp
belt: bear-skin belt (1pp ?)
legs: cloth pants
boots: bearskin boots (1.5pp ?)
wrists: cloth

That's it for my non-twinked 10th lvl .

Hippocrates
Cleric of the Temple of Life
Vallon Zek

> Message: 1
> Date: Thu, 18 Nov 1999 09:14:01 -0500
> From: "Jeff Portwine" <jdport@...>
> Subject: Re: Best looking clerics?....
>
> Heh.. if you are playing for Stats, the best race by far is the Dwarf.
Dwarven Clerics are pretty easy to max out, but also a dime a dozen. I
agree that you should play the race you want to play... if you are a power
gamer, i guess every cleric you create will be a Dwarf. I chose a high elf
because that was what I wanted to play. You have to consider the RP that
you want to show Norrath, rather than whether your dexterity is 75 or 90...
(or whatever number you wanna look at).
>
> Eachann Bronzeleaf
> Cleric of Tunare, Tarew Marr
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Paul Heenan <pheenan@...>
> To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, November 17, 1999 4:56 PM
> Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Best looking clerics?....
>
>
> > From: Paul Heenan <pheenan@...>
> >
> > Hmm...what are the starting stats for halfling clerics? Here is what I
chose
> > for my DE:
> > STR 80
> > STA 80
> > AGI 90
> > DEX 75
> > WIS 98
> > INT 99
> > CHA 60
> > I am pretty sure that the only difference is that a halfling's DEX and
INT
> > are opposite ours. But other than that I play my DE strictly for RP
value. I
> > understand that I am not as dexterous as the little guys. That's the way
> > Innoruuk built me. All I can do is find things to help that stat. I
think
> > it's important to play a character that you like, rather than for the
stats.
> > Sure, if I wanted to max out WIS I would have chosen a High Elf. But
playing
> > a High Elf would not make me happy. My personality fits the role of a
DE, so
> > I choose this character, along with his shortcomings.
> >
> > That's all I have to say about that...
> >
> > Drizben D'Vorn
> > Defiled High Priest of Innoruuk
> > Oblivion Knight of the 29th Circle
> >
> > > From: "Mr. J Daniels" <warpig@...>
> > >
> > > Make a halfing halfings rock, de's suck as clerics, horrible starting
> > > stats.
> > >
> >
> >
>
>

> Message: 5
> Date: Thu, 18 Nov 1999 12:34:30 -0500
> From: Chris Riley <criley@...>
> Subject: Re: Info on two spells and other things
>
>
> >I strongly suggest you stick to one hand blunt. First
> >of all, 2h blunt will cause your stamina to drain
> >FAST! Also, there are many cleric only one hand blunt
> >weapons floating around. Althout the damage is not
> >great, it all adds up. It also gives you the
> >opportunity to hold some great wisdom item in your
> >other hand. SOme prefer the testament or paw, but I
> >prefer a charred guardian shield. +9 wisdom plus AC,
> >it's perfect ;)
>
> Don't forget. Cazic Thule, along with that really big fighter only knife
he
> drops, also has a really big cleric only morning star.
>
>
>
>

> Message: 6
> Date: Thu, 18 Nov 1999 12:37:47 -0500
> From: Chris Riley <criley@...>
> Subject: Re: Stupidity and class boundries (was RE: Why do so many clerics
think they're wizards?)
>
> >who play their character a different one than was intended. The cleric
or
> >enchanter that casts DD are the best examples because both of these
> classes make
> >a group perform much better with less risks when we do OTHER things.
>
> The only time I''ve had to use my DD in a group is in Unrest. Playing with
> yard trash. Everyone just wanted to sit down and rest after surviving a
> train of Werebats, so I just pumped the rest of my mana into word of
> shadow, and let the fighters take out all the beetles and TD's with one
> hit. Then we lay back for a long snooze
>
>
>
>

> Message: 10
> Date: Thu, 18 Nov 1999 19:11:30 GMT
> From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
> Subject: RE: Equipment?
>
> Here is my stuff at 21st. This may be a bit unfare, because on the
> Test server, nothing is ever camped, so I can get stuff easier than on
> a prod server.
>
> face = grotesque mask +7dex -9chr (I bought for 30pp)
> neck = blackened iron medallion (+3 wis/int)
> ear = +3wisdom earring (enchanter)x2 (I paid 30pp apiece)
> head = savant's cap (+3wis/int)
> hands = ringmail gloves (nothing special here)
> chest = dwarven tunic (+8 fire/cold/poison, I think)
> wrist = ivory bracelet (+3 agility, +10 mana)
> wrist = some other bracer, I think it's +20 mana, I'm not sure.
> feet = banded boots
> back = bronze cloak
> legs = banded leggings
> arms = banded arms
> shoulder = lizardscale mantle (+3 wis)
> wisdom = 141 (base 112)
> weapons = enamelled black mace (some 45th level fighter just gave to
> me!), screaming mace (I use it as a flashlight now.) :), 2hb = glowing
> wooden crook, I convinced someone that a bloodforge hammer was better
> and he traded me for it. He was a DE, and he couldn't get one any
> other way, of course. The GWC has a better dmg ratio.
>
> I'm trying to go to Upper guk to get gatorscale leggings. Think I
> might try to go to Befallen and get barbed arms, too.
>
> How much does the silver ruby veil cost? I wasn't familiar with this
> item. I had heard of the platinum one (that is +7 wis), but that is
> way too expensive for me.
>
>
> Ergo Soulhealer
> Test Server

> Message: 11
> Date: Thu, 18 Nov 1999 14:13:48 -0500
> From: "Jeff Portwine" <jdport@...>
> Subject: Re: Equipment?
>
> > How much does the silver ruby veil cost? I wasn't familiar with this
> > item. I had heard of the platinum one (that is +7 wis), but that is
> > way too expensive for me.
>
> The Silver Ruby veil usually sells for around 250pp... but actually you
are within the level range where you can start going to unrest... If you
get another couple of levels you will be able to camp a room in unrest with
ease (with a group of course) and once you do that the money pours in...
most of the undead in the house carry FS weapons. When I was around level
24-26 I was camping the hand room with a group and literally making about
100pp per night (I work all day so one knight is like 4 hours or so for
me...) At that point, it doesn't take all that long to save up for a Plat
ruby veil and it is well worth the money (IMHO). I payed 650pp for my Plat
Ruby veil and it was worht every copper.
>
> You can also save up to buy plat jasper rings and upgrade your rings.
They usually cost around 200pp each. If you look really hard you might be
able to get them for 150-160pp... This gives you a total of +15 wisdom (+7
for the veil and +6 for each ring, -4 wis for the 2 rings you will be
getting rid of) and costs a total of 1000pp or so. It sounds like a lot,
but that wisdom amounts to a pretty good chunk of mana and each wisdom point
counts for more mana every level... so it definately pays off.
>
> -Eachann Bronzeleaf
> -Cleric of Tunare, Tarew Marr
>
>
>
>
>

____________________________________________________________________________

> Message: 12

> From: Paul Heenan <pheenan@...>
> Subject: RE: Equipment?

> Well, at 10th I was in Raw-Hide from head to toe. By 15th, I had mastered
> Blacksmithing and was in Full Banded until my mid 20s. I started our armor
> quests at 25 and am still working on them. I am 29th (2 bubs from 30) now
> and this is what I am wearing (non-twinked, unadulterated, hard-core
> gaming):
>
> Head: Savant's Cap (ac 2, +3 int, +3 wis)
> Face: Platinum Ruby Veil (+7 str, +7 wis)
> Neck: Black Iron Medallion (+3 int, +3 wis)
> Ears: Gold Jasper Earrings x2 (+3 wis)
> Rings: Platinum Jasper Rings x2 (+6 wis)
> Arms: Barbed Armplates (ac 7, +2 dex)
> Wrist: Banded Bracer (ac 6) *just for looks*
> Wrist: Golden Jaded Bracelet (ac 2, +15 mana, +15 hp)
> Hands: Gauntlets of the Ardent (ac 10, +5 agi, +5 cold)
> Shoulders: Lizardscale Mantle (ac 5, +3 int, +3 wis)
> Chest: Dwarven Rinmail Tunic (ac 12, +8 fire, cold, magic)
> Back: Polar Bear Cloak (ac 5, +15 cold)
> Waist: Purity Belt (ac 2, +2 str, +2 sta)
> Legs: Greaves of the Penitent (ac 11, +5 int, +5 poison)
> Feet: Boots of the Reliant (ac 9, +6 disease)
> Primary: Screaming Mace
> Secondary: Testament of Vanear (+10 wis, +10 mana)
>
> Drizben D'Vorn
> Defiled High Priest of Innoruuk
> Oblivion Knight of the 29th Circle

> Message: 18
> Date: Thu, 18 Nov 1999 11:20:51 -0500
> From: "Cliff, Monty" <mcliff@...>
> Subject: Re[2]: Equipment?
>
>
> The game has changed a lot since I started (first week of release) so
> the items I had at various levels are a lot different that what
people
> have today. I didn't know anyone that was high level that could help
> me out as there were very few high level chars and places like lower
> guk were largely unexplored. Not to mention that permafrost wasn't
> even itemized.
>
> When I was L10 I hadn't ventured out of misty thicket and was wearing
> patchwork/cloth with no magic items at all (except my hammer of
> wrath).
>
> By L20 I was fighting in oasis and was wearing mostly banded armor
> with a few patchwork pieces. Still no jewelry beyond dervish rings.
> The one good item I did have was the crook from lockjaw when we were
> actually able to get the kill.
>
> By L30 I think I had mostly bronze plate from fighting in unrest and
> lake rathe and possibly some +4wis +2st rings, BI medallion and
> polished bone bracers (can't exactly remember). Also might have had
> an enameled mace and mistmoor shield by this time.
>
> In the low 30's is when I started to make some money from mistmoor
and
> when I moved to sol b at L34. Then the good stuff started coming in
> :).
>
> Now compare this to what people have out there today and you can tell
> it's a lot different and I'm not one to judge yourself on. I've
> always felt that it's not the items that make you a good cleric.
>
> I sometimes feel sorry for new players out there now. There are so
> many twinks running around in awesome equipment it must be hard
seeing
> someone that con's green wearing way better equipment than you are.
>
> Just remember, A naked L30 cleric could beat the crap out of a L20
> cleric with awesome equipment :)
>
> Drogo DarkBane
> L50 Halfling Cleric
> The Rathe
>
> P.S. Were the other high level clerics on this list like this as
> well?
>
>
>
> >>Well, I consider myself to be under equipped for my level (getting
harder to
> >>say that now that I have some purple stuff) as I have had a few items
for
> >>almost 30 levels now. Anyway I'll give you a run down on the items I
wear.
>
>
> >How about posting a list of what you were wearing at the milestones (lvl
> >10, lvl 20, etc) That way we could see what we should be looking for when
> >we reach those levels.
>
>
>
>

> Message: 21
> Date: Thu, 18 Nov 1999 14:34:04 -0800
> From: "Sirensa Qi'Seraph" <Sirensa@...>
> Subject: Olden Days
>
> I too started my cleric way back when twinking did not exist. And I did
> absolutely NO research into what stats were good for starting as a cleric.
>
> I think I was totally nekkid (lost my newbie armor when I lost my corpse -
> hehehe) until about level 5 when I got some patchwork. At about level 7 I
> received a Runed Totem Staff from a necro friend that was about 5 levels
> higher (and he was soooo OLD then!) I was the envy of all the other
newbie
> DE clerics.
>
> I was still wearing patchwork into my late teens - at which time I was
able
> to acquire some ringmail and bronze. By early 20's I was all Bronze armor
> with +2 wis rings!
>
> It wasn't until about level 25 that I started to get some +wis increasing
> decent items =) Including an Observer Staff!!
>
> Sooo... the moral of this story is - It is NOT about what you wear, it's
> about how well you play your class. (well maybe a little bit about how
you
> look - the purple stuff sure is nice!) hehehe.
>
> ~Sirensa
> Priestess of Innoruuk
> Solusek Ro
>
>
>
>
